result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Ireland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at the rate of $50 per month commencing 06-01-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 8 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.
Case 15CT267 was dismissed and read in.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Anthony M Ireland in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  

Defendant has paid up front restitution.
Based on the up front restitution being paid, state moves to amend the felony to a misdemeanor.
Amended Information Filed.
Defense has no objections.


Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.


Court orders the following:
Fine:  $452
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 06/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  8 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.

Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.
